H0.text: Which journalist first told the world about the My Lai massacre. Seymour M. Hersh's contemporary, Robert Scheer

H1.text: Which journalist first told the world about the My Lai massacre. Investigative journalist, I.F. Stone

H2.text: Which journalist first told the world about the My Lai massacre. CBS News anchor, Walter Cronkite

H3.text: Which journalist first told the world about the My Lai massacre. Sy Hersh

A4.text: Hersh's first article on the massacre was published by Dispatch News Service, which sold the story to 35 national newspapers

A5.text: Hersh's reporting led to the exposure of the My Lai massacre, for which he received the Pulitzer Prize

A6.text: My Lai was first revealed to the public on 13 November 1969—more than a year and a half after the incident—when Hersh published a story through the Dispatch News Service
